comments:
Build ID: Latest source

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Export OpenUP as a config.
2. Use File menu to create a empty new lib
3. Import the exported config OpenUP.
4. See the following exception
MultiFileResourceSetImpl.cleanUp(): removed resources: []
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.services.ConfigurationImportService.collectPotentialTypeChanged(ConfigurationImportService.java:427)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.services.ConfigurationImportService.handleTypeChanges(ConfigurationImportService.java:383)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.services.ConfigurationImportService.analyze(ConfigurationImportService.java:172)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.wizards.SelectImportConfigurationSource$1.run(SelectImportConfigurationSource.java:124)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)



More information:
This is a regression in the head branch. Something changed either in import wizard or lib service causing it
Seems fix for bug 184380 causes the problem in the HEAD stream.

Place breakpoint at line 148 of SelectImportConfigurationSource: PluginModifyInfo modifyInfo = checkModify();

Debug into checkModify(), the current lib return from LibraryService is null.

Reassigning this bug to Weiping since it is related to the current Import Method Configuration wizard implementation and the recent RFE implementation to automatically close a method library when a method library project is closed.

The project we have in the config export is not the same as the current library project. Closing this project should not close the current library.

I suggest we introduce a 2nd close project API to accommodate this.
Fixed by skiping closing the current lib if the closed project is not the current lib's project.
Fix is verified on EPF 1.2 M3 20070615-1148. Closed.
